name: A Quiz on Mountain Lions | Felidae-Cat Family | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following states was the first to ban mountain lion hunting?
questions.explanation:
California.

	California banned it permanently in 1990 with the passage of Proposition 117, but no cougar hunting has been allowed in the state since 1971.

questions.text: What is the scientific name of the mountain lion?
questions.explanation:
Felis concolor & Puma concolor.

	It means 'cat of one color'.

questions.text: Which two states were the first to ban mountain lion hunting with hounds?
questions.explanation:
Oregon and Washington.

	Unfortunately, many states still allow this barbaric practice.

questions.text: The 'hot spot' for mountain lion attacks on humans in North America is:
Mountain lion cubs differ in appearance from adult lions in that they are:
questions.explanation:
Spotted.

	The spots fade as the kittens grow.

questions.text: The primary prey of the mountain lion is:
questions.explanation:
Deer.

	Elk are also a primary prey animal, in areas where they are found.

False.

	Mountain lions cannot roar; they are the largest of the "purring cats."

questions.text: The closest living relative of the mountain lion, as shown by genetic studies, is the:
questions.explanation:
Cheetah.

	Mountain lions share some characteristics with cheetahs- for example, both use whistling, birdlike calls.

questions.text: Cougars are famous for their 'scream', said to sound like a woman. From which animal is this noise most likely produced?
questions.explanation:
A female in heat.

	Imagine a domestic cat in heat, now think bigger...MUCH bigger.
